column5: way to go Bly!!!!!!!!!!!! still kickin Cliff's butt..lol.. have the bruises gone away from the last time? so does this make Cliff the NET BOY now?   team work is what its all about. way to go !!!!  Dann
Wow, Carole.  I bow before your greatness.  That is one fantastic fish, and a testament to your fishiness in landing that one.  Attagurl!

WTG go Carole you must be in much better shape than Cliff because you usually get the bigger fish what a agreat way to keep the muscles toned .34lbs only in my dreams .My heaviest fish to date is only 11.5 lbs.  Mike
LOL everyone....  Ok...let's clear a few things up here....  Nailpolish - Tried it a few times, didn't work.  Netboy - I'm well used to it by now!!!  It sure was a tank of a fish!!!
well done bly congrats
Congrats!  That's a monster!  I thought Cliff's salmon were pretty big until I saw this one.
That's a huge fish! Congrats to Bly,  ehg
awesome catch  thats one ugly pig of a fish  that could of been a derby winner , crap!   you cant eeat something like that can you?
Bly that is a monster!!!!!  It would eat the poor brookies I've been catching recently for breakfast  Good job!!!
WOW Bly    That is a monster for sure  Congratulation    Your smile says it all  You guys sure put in a lot of time and got rewarded Again WTG and thanks for sharing Leechman
Awesome Fish Bly    they sure can fight and make your heart pound.
wow when Bly goes big she really goes big, maybe I need to invite her on my next musky trip so someone finally boats a 50 incher plus fish in my boat this year
Way to go Carole!!!   Nice job to the net man.  (insert pat on the back) Well, Cliff, now you know how a 30lb+ salmon feels now.
AWESOME FISH!!!!!  A quick question, is that Cliff's nail polish you're using??
What a beast! Smokes my PB by a couple pounds too, and in the rivers to boot. Congrats!
HOLY C H I T !!!
Congrats Bly, a very impressive Salmon.  Kudos to the netman as well.
Nice fish Bly!!...congrats
wtg Bly! That is a nice one for sure.
Double Dang!  Is your nail polish scented Carole!!!!

Thank you everyone!!  I must thank my net man also....if it weren't for Cliff, the battle may have ended differently!        I haven't a clue how to keep a fish like that still but I do have an excellent camera man     I lifted the fish maybe 18 inches and realized there was no way I was going to be able to safely hold it with my arms alone, it was resting on my legs for the picture.   The power was amazing, I cannot even imagine fighting a fish like that in it's prime.   Not likely   Still have so very much to learn   Bill, I'd be happy to trade that salmon for some of the gorgeous brookies that you catch   We share many things but that is not one of them.....my polish is strictly off limits to him   Thanks Rich, that fish was caught off a pier in about 15-20' of water.  I tried the trib a couple of times last year for salmon and didn't care for it.  Prefer the piers, using the canoe in the harbor or wading out into the lake for them.
well I am sure the local moron who has been dumping on me about photoshopping will have something negative to say but here goes anyway
I wasn't aware that T.J. had hired a local moron for the forum
So I bet i know who is doing the dishes this weekend? LOL Jose  Great King BTW
WOW thats some fish  Congrats  Maybe red is your new lucky colour?  Bet you cant wait to do it again
By the way...nice hat.Faux Farm in Paeonian Springs is getting famous.Nice fish! Joe
wow that is a huge fish!  Cheers!
Amazing catch. congrads!
Seems you've found the perfect woman there Cliff. Nice going Carole! That is one massive beast !!!
WTG BLY!!!! POOR CLIFF !!! LOL

One night after I said on the board that I just couldn't break the 40" mark with Salmon, Bly completely destroyed it!!!  Anyhow...first the story.  We got to the same spot as last night...we could hear and see salmon jumping close by.  Once again, those glow in the dark cleos did the trick!  We were feeling strikes, but no hookups....until Bly suddenly says "Ok...fish on!".  This fish would NOT come up at first and she wasn't able to make any headway on it.  She managed to turn it's head around a few times to keep it under control, but lose 10 feet in the process....this went on for a good 10 minutes.  Suddenly, it goes on a straight run away from her....line is peeling from her reel like there's no tomorrow.  I look down and see her gently thumb her spool and sure enough....the little added pressure did the trick, and she got it turned around and started to reel it back in.  When I looked down and saw the fish I told her it was a HUGE one!  It barely fit in our net....but we got it out of the water.  Here it is...not the prettiest fish, but a BIG one!  It measured in at 45" and weighed a whopping 34 pounds 1 ounce!!
would you win the derby with 34 lb?  nice catch
Holy!! that's a big one. Way to go Bly!
JHC!!! That's a Hugh Jass fish!!!  Is it just me... or does bly get sexier as the fish get bigger???
WAY TO GO, BLY!!!  Cliff...I'm starting to sense a pattern here.
Holy crap, what a beast!  Congrats to Bly!  Just knew you'd put Cliff in his place soon
I was expecting dinner photos.  Nice fish.

Congrats Carole! WOW, that's a huge fish!!!  Cliff: this is expected from the ladies, so don't feel too bad  just joking, you'll get ur 40 soon enough!
Wow, huge fish.  You guys put in the hours and make it pay!  How did you keep it still (and off the ground) long enough to take a pic?  forrest
